trans-unit.source: Creates a window station object, associates it with the calling process, and assigns it to the current session

seg-source.mrk: Creates a window station object, associates it with the calling process, and assigns it to the current session

target.mrk: Creates a window station object, associates it with the calling process, and assigns it to the current session

trans-unit.source: [optional] The name of the window station to be created. Window station names are case-insensitive and cannot contain backslash characters (\).

seg-source.mrk: The name of the window station to be created.
Window station names are case-insensitive and cannot contain backslash characters (\).

target.mrk: The name of the window station to be created.
Window station names are case-insensitive and cannot contain backslash characters (\).

trans-unit.source: Only members of the Administrators group are allowed to specify a name.

seg-source.mrk: Only members of the Administrators group are allowed to specify a name.

target.mrk: Only members of the Administrators group are allowed to specify a name.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is empty string (Default), the system forms a window station name using the logon session identifier for the calling process.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is empty string (Default), the system forms a window station name using the logon session identifier for the calling process.

target.mrk: If this parameter is empty string (Default), the system forms a window station name using the logon session identifier for the calling process.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The type of access the returned handle has to the window station. This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: The type of access the returned handle has to the window station.
This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

target.mrk: The type of access the returned handle has to the window station.
This parameter can be one or more of the following values:

trans-unit.source: [optional] The optional flags. It can be zero (Default) or the following value:

seg-source.mrk: It can be zero (Default) or the following value:

target.mrk: It can be zero (Default) or the following value:

trans-unit.source: [optional] $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that determines whether the returned handle can be inherited by child processes. If this parameter is 0 (Default), the handle cannot be inherited.

seg-source.mrk: $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that determines whether the returned handle can be inherited by child processes.
If this parameter is 0 (Default), the handle cannot be inherited.

target.mrk: $tagSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES structure that determines whether the returned handle can be inherited by child processes.
If this parameter is 0 (Default), the handle cannot be inherited.

trans-unit.source: Handle to the newly created window station. If the specified window station already exists, the function succeeds and returns a handle to the existing window station.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the newly created window station.
If the specified window station already exists, the function succeeds and returns a handle to the existing window station.

target.mrk: Handle to the newly created window station.
If the specified window station already exists, the function succeeds and returns a handle to the existing window station.

trans-unit.source: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: 0, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

trans-unit.source: After you are done with the handle, you must call _WinAPI_CloseWindowStation() to free the handle.

seg-source.mrk: After you are done with the handle, you must call _WinAPI_CloseWindowStation() to free the handle.

target.mrk: After you are done with the handle, you must call _WinAPI_CloseWindowStation() to free the handle.
